text: Is there somewhere I could go to read on why Julia seems to have such great composability? I've heard a lot of people say this, and I've used some Julia packages that have quite impressed me with their composability, but it's never really been obvious to me _why_ this is the case.

elements.text: Is there somewhere I could go to read on why Julia seems to have such great composability? I've heard a lot of people say this, and I've used some Julia packages that have quite impressed me with their composability, but it's never really been obvious to me

attachments.title: JuliaCon 2019 | The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Multiple Dispatch | Stefan Karpinski
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: JuliaCon 2019 | The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Multiple Dispatch | Stefan Karpinski
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kc9HwsxE1OY?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: I would say it has great potential for composability but composing unexpected combinations of types and functions often requires code changes
